properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the alert.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Required) Description of the alert.

properties.name: active
properties.description: whether the alert is active (can be triggered). Defaults to true.

properties.name: rearm_seconds
properties.description: minimum amount of time between sending alert notifications, in seconds.

properties.name: services
properties.description: list of notification service IDs.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: A trigger condition for the alert. Conditions documented below.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: A hash of additional attribtues for the alert. Attributes documented below.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of metric to create (gauge, counter, or composite).

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the metric.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: The name which will be used for the metric when viewing the Metrics website.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Text that can be used to explain precisely what the metric is measuring.

properties.name: period
properties.description: Number of seconds that is the standard reporting period of the metric.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: The attributes hash configures specific components of a metric’s visualization.

properties.name: composite
properties.description: The definition of the composite metric.
The following arguments are supported. Please check the relevant documentation for each type of alert.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of notificaion.

properties.name: title
properties.description: (Required) The alert title.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: (Required) a JSON hash of settings specific to the alert type.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the space.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: space_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the space this chart should be in.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The title of the chart when it is displayed.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the type of chart. Must be one of line or stacked (default to line).

properties.name: min
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum display value of the chart's Y-axis.

properties.name: max
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum display value of the chart's Y-axis.

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Optional) The Y-axis label.

properties.name: related_space
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of another space to which this chart is related.

properties.name: stream
properties.description: (Optional) Nested block describing a metric to use for data in the chart. The structure of this block is described below.
The stream block supports:

properties.name: metric
properties.description: (Required) The name of the metric. May not be specified if composite is specified.

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Required) The name of a source, or * to include all sources. This field will also accept specific wildcard entries. For example us-west-*-app will match us-west-21-app but not us-west-12-db. Use % to specify a dynamic source that will be provided after the instrument or dashboard has loaded, or in the URL. May not be specified if composite is specified.

properties.name: group_function
properties.description: (Required) How to process the results when multiple sources will be returned. Value must be one of average, sum, breakout. If average or sum, a single line will be drawn representing the average or sum (respectively) of all sources. If the group_function is breakout, a separate line will be drawn for each source. If this property is not supplied, the behavior will default to average. May not be specified if composite is specified.

properties.name: composite
properties.description: (Required) A composite metric query string to execute when this stream is displayed. May not be specified if metric, source or group_function is specified.

properties.name: summary_function
properties.description: (Optional) When visualizing complex measurements or a rolled-up measurement, this allows you to choose which statistic to use. Defaults to "average". Valid options are: "max", "min", "average", "sum" or "count".

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) A display name to use for the stream when generating the tooltip.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Optional) Sets a color to use when rendering the stream. Must be a seven character string that represents the hex code of the color e.g. "#52D74C".

properties.name: units_short
properties.description: (Optional) Unit value string to use as the tooltip label.

properties.name: units_long
properties.description: (Optional) String value to set as they Y-axis label. All streams that share the same units_long value will be plotted on the same Y-axis.

properties.name: min
properties.description: (Optional) Theoretical minimum Y-axis value.

properties.name: max
properties.description: (Optional) Theoretical maximum Y-axis value.

properties.name: transform_function
properties.description: (Optional) Linear formula to run on each measurement prior to visualization.

properties.name: period
properties.description: (Optional) An integer value of seconds that defines the period this stream reports at. This aids in the display of the stream and allows the period to be used in stream display transforms.
